p: Blood specimens were obtained from patients with enteric infections which included cholera, ETEC, typhoid and as well as healthy participants who received two doses of heat-killed oral cholera vaccine (Shanchol, Shantha biotechnics, India). Cholera and ETEC-infected patients were culture confirmed by isolation of Vibrio cholerae O1 and enterotoxigenic Escherichia coli (ETEC) from stool specimens respectively. ETEC was confirmed by the presence of heat-labile toxin (LT) or heat-stable toxin (ST) or both by ELISA and PCR [ 13]. Typhoid fever was confirmed by isolation of Salmonella Typhi from blood of febrile patients. Patients were given appropriate antibiotics by physicians as was needed ( S1 Table). Specimens were collected between January 2016 and December 2017.
